alert.note: Alert for Austin; Brazos; Fort Bend; Grimes; Inland Harris; Madison; Montgomery; Walker; Waller; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 2:46PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Austin, Grimes, eastern Brazos, eastern Washington, north central Fort Bend, western Montgomery, southwestern Madison, northern Waller, southwestern Walker and northwestern Harris Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 244 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Hempstead to Waller to near Katy. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain could result in localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Southeastern College Station, Katy, Navasota, Hempstead, Prairie View, Pinehurst, southwestern Eldridge / West Oaks, Washington, Hockley, Waller, Magnolia, Pine Island, Bedias, Millican, Anderson, Todd Mission, Cinco Ranch, Iola, Dobbin and Dacus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in League City.

area.areaDesc: Austin; Brazos; Fort Bend; Grimes; Inland Harris; Madison; Montgomery; Walker; Waller; Washington
